choices.answer: Personality types
Ability to do a task or skill practically perfect every time
Intelligences (multiple and/or single)
Preferred ways for taking in/learning new information
Aural Learners
Kinesthetic Learners
Reading/Writing Learners
Verbal & Linguistic Learners

questions.question: Which is NOT a VISUAL learning strategy?

choices.answer: Draw diagrams and flowcharts
Write out definitions
Use different color inks to emphasis different information
Convert your notes to a visual format

questions.question: Which is NOT an Aural learning strategy?

choices.answer: Read your notes aloud
Listen to your own voice as you answer questions on the exam
Discuss topics with others
Translate diagrams, graphs, etc., into text

questions.question: Which is NOT a Reading/Writer learning strategy?

choices.answer: Write out definitions
Journal about what youâ€™re learning
Draw diagrams and flowcharts
Translate   diagrams, graphs, etc., into text

questions.question: Which is NOT a Kinesthetic learning strategy?

choices.answer: Read your notes again and again silently
Take advantage of labs
Use all your senses while studying
Remember and write down examples the prof. gives

questions.question: In the quote "The chariot of human behavior" what is the difference between cognition & affect?

choices.answer: One is passion and the other is logic
One is emotion and the other is thinking/logic/reason
One is thinking/logic and the other is feelings/emotion
One is common sense and the other is emotion
